body.p:
HEAD-QUARTERS ACT'G ASST. PROVOST MARSHAL GENERAL,
STATE OF KENTUCKY,
Louisivlle, Ky 13th Decr 1863
Brig Genl John Boyle, Adjt Genl of Ky
Frankfort Ky
General
A Young officer Capt Bacon came to me ^(without any men)^ with an order from Hd Qrs Deptn of the Cumberland worded thus
"IV Capt John Bacon 4th Ky Caly is detailed for recruiting service in Kentucky. He will report in person to the Superintendent of Recruiting for the State and by letter to the Governor."

As I have not the slightest necessity for such an officer and under our present system do not well know how to apply him I would at once send him back to his regiment but that he tells me the detail was made by General Thomas on Governor Bramlette's special request; -- but he lives in Frankfort &c

I would like to know the facts in the case, and if Governor Bramlette desires to have him near him in the recruiting department for ^U. S.^ if your office to which I might detail him. I will
not assign Captain Bacon or send him back to his regiment until I can have time to hear from you or the Governor on the subject. Please also, anticipate what you may write by a telegraphic communication

I am Restly
General
Your Obt Servt
W W helm
Major 15 U S Infy
A A P M G
